body_content.explanation: a force or influence that stretches, pulls, or puts pressure on something, sometimes causing damage:
examples: The hurricane put such a strain on the bridge that it collapsed.
As you get older, excess weight puts a lot of strain on the heart.
Their constant arguments were putting a strain on their marriage.
The recent decline in the dollar has put a bigger strain on the economic system.
Migration into the cities is putting a strain on already stretched resources.

body_content.explanation: an injury to a muscle or similar soft part of the body caused by using that part too much:
something that makes you feel nervous and worried:
examples: She's a lot better than she was but she's still not ready to face the stresses and strains of a job.
He's been under a lot of strain recently.
A strain of puritanism runs through all her work.

body_content.explanation: an animal or plant from a particular group whose characteristics are different in some way from others of the same group:
examples: Scientists have discovered a new strain of the virus which is much more dangerous.

body_content.explanation: the sound of music being played or performed:
examples: I could hear the strains of Mozart in the background.

body_content.explanation: to separate liquid food from solid food, especially by pouring it through a utensil with small holes in it:
examples: Could you strain the vegetables, please.
The oil in which the fish is fried is strained off and used to cook potatoes.

body_content.explanation: to become stretched or to experience pressure, or to make something do or experience this:
examples: I've put on such a lot of weight recently - this dress is straining at the seams.
I strained a muscle in my back playing squash.
Don't watch TV in the dark - you'll strain your eyes!
I really had to strain (= try very hard) to reach those top notes.
I was straining (my ears) (= listening hard) to hear what they were saying.

body_content.explanation: to cause too much of something to be used, especially money:
examples: Increases in wholesale oil prices have strained the company's finances.
